metadata.name: PRINTERS #7
metadata.description:
Generative animated artwork made using shader feedback and pixel quantization.

PRINTERS is a study of rasterized type and bitmap imagery. It builds on the tradition of ASCII and typographic art, blending dithering techniques with chunky, pixelated glyphs. Here, the movement and blending of color is interpreted as a monochrome composition of recognizable pixel patterns taken from legacy video games and operating systems. What appears as typography is actually a custom set of 8x8 pixel patterns rendered in a GLSL shader that produces a conceptual tension between low-res graphics and high-power GPU computation.

PRINTERS is designed to be both viewed on a screen and printed on office paper with a home/office inkjet printer.

Press 'i' to invert the colors.
Press '1', '2', or '3' to scale the bitmap glyphs.
Press 'g' to download a looping animated GIF (90 frames).
Press 's' to capture a single frame.
Press 'f' (or double tap in mobile) to stretch to full screen.
Made with vanilla javascript and GLSL. By @galoandstuff.

metadata.name: Chaos Research #99
metadata.description:
No feature, no attribute, believe what you see.

ileivoivm (AluanWang) - @IOivm, Dec 2021

metadata.name: Electron Microscopy #38
metadata.description:
The signed distance field of connected capsules are transformed by a 3D kaleidoscopic iterated system. The results of this method are varied but I aimed to the flower-like shapes and other weird structures. I used a raymarching technique that keeps the ray running through the surface while accumulating sdf data. All is done using a single fragment shader.

Variations come from the initial values of the iterated function system. Color tint also varies.

metadata.name: glory hole$ #769
metadata.description:
our consciousness as humans can be distilled into a crudely fashioned hole at an abandoned dave & busters and the meditative state that is endured while sitting on a neglected toilet praying for the sound of disrupted waters. glory holes embody anonymity and pleasure for pleasure's sake. they are creations that cannot be destroyed, as they exist in the memories of anyone who uses or witnesses. many speculate that the carving of the hole is the purest form of human ingenuity and the desire to explore the unknown. formerly limited to the physical space. these glory holes transcend space and time. and exist in that same unknown that tempts us all. legalize ground beef. create nothing. consume everything.

HUGE thank you to @PureSpider for the layered PNG template, this dream would not have been realized without you friend.

that’s why we here at Fxck Kulture Labz (a partner of Meatverse) are creating a one of a kind, grassroots, visionary project that euthanizes the need to think before consumption and destroys everything that came before. we’ve rented out a mall kiosk that used to sell metal dragons holding orbs and shrimp deveiners shaped like medieval hernia belts and have transformed it into a one stop shop for factory farmed revolutionary art that is perfect top soil for more genetically modified celebrities and brands to spawn from. because we at Fxck Kulture LaBz believe that creation is simply a pointless product of consumption and what you put in will never come back out.

each celebrity has been hand crafted for ideal cultural impact, with varying deformities, goiters and impacted hairs grown thoughtfully from the medical waste of other celebrities who are also desperate for another insufferable attention grab. they’ve sacrificed themselves for you. because you didn’t have what it took to build something. so do what you need to do. for them. by buying their deformed, barely sentient heads to worship at. it would really make them feel better. and there’s nothing worse than an upset genetically modified celebrity and brand collaboration corpse.

feed them. grow them. wonder if this means anything at all. drink from the never ending drain of reheated influencer bath water. die with the most likes.

thank you @purespider for the code!

metadata.name: Skravert #154
metadata.description:
‘Skravert’ - Norwegian, verb, past tense. ‘The act of filling an area with lines; to shade an area’.

Skravert is a series of 320 sketches, each capturing the texture and feel of a material residing somewhere between cardboard and woolen rugs. The project is centred around rectangle subdivision and a line drawing algorithm, giving each piece its own unique expression when combined with a selection of 28 different color  palettes.  

Original artwork by perkwerk * made with p5.js * 2021

metadata.name: Chroma Ciphers #123
metadata.description:
A generative series using the most basic of building blocks accentuated with colors.

This is the second Ciphers generative token in a series of three.

metadata.name: Bubblemania #3
metadata.description:
This small project is several things:

1. First and foremost, it's a little, light "visual ASMR" treat to bring some positivity into your day - some "Maluma" softness to contrast the more common "Takete" of contemporary generative art aesthetics[1].

2. A small gift to celebrate the fledgling generative art/design community on Mastodon: 20 of the 128 tokens are given to some of the people in that slowly growing community, with the remainder given as Thank You (and smoke signal/sign of life) to some of my existing collectors, randomly chosen via lottery script[2].

3. For those so inclined, and with a bit of hand-holding, ChatGPT explains the _true_ conceptual depths of this project much better than I ever could:

"The bubbles in this generative art piece serve as a reflection of the human experience, reminding us of our own impermanence and the ephemeral nature of all things. The piece invites us to contemplate the fundamental questions of human existence and speaks to our innate curiosity and desire to understand the world around us.

Through the convergence of science and art, this piece reveals the infinite complexity and unpredictability of the world while also hinting at the underlying order that exists within the chaos of the universe. It reminds us that even in the midst of uncertainty, there is beauty and order to be found, and that it is through the pursuit of knowledge and understanding that we can find meaning and purpose in our lives."

Isn't that lovely & who can argue with that?! :)

4. I often revisit projects/ideas after many years, mainly to re-examine them with new eyes/knowledge/tools and/or to get answers/verification which I couldn't get earlier. This is one of these instances. So for the more rational-minded, this is a TypeScript/GLSL (WebGL) version of an older Clojure/Houdini project (from 2016) to generate a Voronoi via the simulation of intersecting sphere meshes (aka foam bubbles). In this new version the sim & deformations are done in realtime (~4M vertices, mainly via vertex shader). Also added some _basic_ physics and procedural textures to create more of a quirky character (hopefully complemented by the different color themes and other params).

Made with ❤️ and https://thi.ng/umbrella!

[1] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bouba/kiki_effect
[2] https://gist.github.com/postspectacular/3d970e02570b7dfd32d03d43e1e7e3e0

Hotkeys:

SPACE : pause/play
X     : export current frame as PNG

Ultra-widescreen support:

The piece should be adaptive to aspect ratios from 1:3 (portrait) to 4:1 (landscape).

metadata.name: Manu #37
metadata.description:
Manu
---------------

A collector-led exploration of minimalist imperfect line work.

Outputs are generated from a combination of the minter's address, their choice from one of 50 seeds, and options to adjust how the generated surface is presented.

Palettes are named after native New Zealand birds and range from the subdued to the colorful.

There are no especially rare traits so mint what you love :)

---------------

Controls:
S - Export as png
H - Toggle high resolution

metadata.name: Sketches:Pairs of Tails:Majestic Creatures #29
metadata.description:
Addendum to Annuls of WorSAGE (the Worshipful Society of Adventurers and Generative Explorers) XXVII.Vol.2048

There is a significantly common phenomena in which Pairs of "Tails of Majestic Creatures" are found together. Various sketches of these "Pairs" have been collated and are available, free of charge, the collectors of the initial Tails of Majestic Creatures collection based upon a recently taken collection registry snapshot. 

These sketches are available on a one per collector basis and for a limited time only after which they will no longer be accessible.

The sketches come in 2 forms - an ink and color style, and a pencil style - for which different colored paper has been used.

The digitally minded can press s to get a 5000x3000 download of a sketch.

metadata.name: Shift #113
metadata.description:
A generative algorithm honing the power of vertical displacement.

How simple may a generative algorithm be while simultaneously staying diverse enough for each art piece to be truly unique? Shift is the result of an exploration into this space, basing its existence on two principles — dissection and vertical shifting. Each variable in this art engine has been meticulously weighted, giving rise to high diversity and the possibility of epic combinations. 

Shift is a series of 888 unique pieces.

############

Display resolution is 1000x1400. Press ’s’ (in live mode) to generate a 6000x8400 hi-res image. This may take a while to generate depending on your hardware.

Original artwork by perkwerk * made with p5.js * 2022

metadata.name: regenerate #20
metadata.description:
## regenerate : what is it about? ##

I wanted the gradients to portray our inner energy status, like a power charge we keep regenerating. Made of many steps, they create the illusion of continuity. And, just like us, they sometimes disfunction.❤️

The title illustrates both the energy of these geometric outputs and my own return to a generative art practice. It's also a nod to the "degen" culture.

## variations ##

regenerate has 3 types of outputs:
- the single column, in full color - these are the main outputs and define the visual identity of the drop - pure energy!
- the single color column on grey - pure contrast!
- the triplet - dysfunctional in the best sense!
Well, there might be a 4th type, but that's a surprise...

For each mint, the number of steps will vary from 60 to 200+. The way the gradients blend into the larger background also depends on the mint: some blend completely, while other tend to the background color but never quite reach it.

## Keyboards controls ##

's' saves a high-res version of your output (4096x4096 px)
‘m’ saves a low-res version (500 x 500 px), useful for social media
'p' saves TWO smartphone formatted crops (1176 x 2556 px) so you can take your mint with you all day - one in full saturation, one at half saturation - you can use one for your lockscreen and one for your homescreen, for example, or you can make your own crops from the high-res image.

## Technical note ##

Depending on the size of your window, the number of steps may vary. That is intentional, and made to avoid any moire effects when scaling down. Instead, the overall impression of the output will remain visually the same at any scale.

## Conclusion ## 

I hope you enjoy your mint, whether it's a single, triplet, or a powerful color on grey!
Thanks for reading and thanks for minting! 🙏

-raphael, sept. 2023.
